newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices gain, trade awaits budget.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices gain, trade awaits budget.

text.p: Indian cotton prices gained on Friday but the trade was cautious ahead of the government budget to be presented to parliament later in the day, dealers said.
Trading volume remained slow and millers kept away in anticipation of the budget.
"The finance minister may reduce duties on polyester fibre which may in turn adversely affect cotton consumption," one broker said.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi rose by 10/15 rupees to 805/840 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned climbed up by 15/20 rupees to 1,440/1,660 rupees per maund.
Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) rose by 100 rupees to 11,500/11,700 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
